intro: Goniothalamus walkeri, commonly known as the Bornean flame tree, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. The plant has compound leaves with multiple leaflets and produces small, round fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and hill forest areas. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
